comments.commentBody: I'll quote Josh Marshall, TPM:  Astronomers can't see black holes directly. They map them by their event horizon and their effect on nearby stars and stellar matter. We can't see yet what's at the center of the Trump/Russia black hole. But we can tell a lot about its magnitude by the scope of the event horizon and the degree of its gravitational pull, which is immense.

It's called 'consciousness of guilt'. Session's volunteering of his not meeting any Russians is called consciousness of guilt. He knew at that hearing if he had referenced any meeting with a Russian, it would have torpedoed the whole hearing, and his nomination because Trump would have had to pull it. It's called consciousness of guilt.

AHA! So, if Sessions said nothing about meeting with Russians, that would be “lying by omission,” whereas volunteering, without being asked, that he did not meet with Russians is “consciousness of guilt.” I get it!

It’s like all these guys have a PhD in Nuanced Lying, which they obtained after their Master’s Degree in Flat Out Lying.

Now I have a question: What if Sessions said something like: “They’re lying if they say I met with Russians because I’m certain nobody saw me.” Is there a term for that? I’d like to know because somewhere along the way I’m sure we’re going to get that one.

With Republicans in Congress turning a blind eye to the Sessions scandal, if it later transpires that Sessions and Flynn were acting as Trump intermediaries to obtain Putin's help in rigging the election, then it will appear to most everyone that the GOP has allied itself with the prime enemy of American democracy. At that point the GOP will be the second-most popular political party in Moscow, and the third-most popular party in Washington.

I'll close with a short Watergate quiz.

What was the principal lesson of Watergate?
a) Birds of a feather flock together.
b) A word to the wise is sufficient.
c) Wake up and smell the coffee.
d) Pride goeth before a fall.
e) You reap what you sow.

Answer: f) All of the above.

Why deny, mislead, lie, and cover-up meetings with Russian individuals and officials if the intent was innocuous and routine? I cannot answer this question in a way that puts the Trump administration in a positive light.
Trump brought suspicions upon himself as early as the Republican presidential primaries, praising Putin, embracing Russian foreign policy (which is anti-democracy), and speaking of a new world order. In my view, Trump was mentally deficient or was compromised in some way - personally, financially, or ideologically - because Putin is not a friend to the US or to western democracies. To those who read international politics, this much was clear.
Since Trump's campaign was textbook white nationalism, the similarities to European white nationalist political parties cannot be ignored, and many of these European parties are openly funded by Putin's political apparatus.
Today, Trump is deflecting blame onto President Obama and others because they met with Russian officials. Meeting with Russian officials is NOT THE POINT here. It is the sneaky cover-up.

We are in a hall of mirrors, turn the tables, double standards era that boggles not only the mind but the heart.

Sessions argues that during the election he was two separate entities: a senator and a campaign surrogate. This split existence allows him to say that he can meet the Russian ambassador (whether in Cleveland or on Mars) in his Senator persona which is a disculpate status. Do we conclude that since he was one of the first to endorse Trump and he often attended Trump's rallies while folks shouted "Lock her up," presumably he was standing there mutely (although perhaps with an aw shucks expression on his face), presumably in surrogate mode so as not to besmirch his other half, the Senator, member of America's most hallowed deliberative body.

Of course, Republicans in that body are touting the idea that Sessions has two identities, one of which trumps the other a per convenience, whereas not one single Republican swallowed the argument that when Loretta Lynch was approached by Bill Clinton on the infamous tarmac, he was acting as a Grandparent Surrogate, as was she, and their other personas, wife of Hillary and Attorney General, were not operable in the moment.

The Tarnished Golden Rule of GOP politics? When a Democrat does it, it must be treason. When a Republican does it, casuistry will suffice to douse it away. (We could also discuss Pence's hacked AOL account in this context, but you get the idea.)

Really thoughtful post. Two meetings is a stretch. Mtg #1 at an ambassador function with at least 25 other foreign ambassadors. Mtg # 2, one half hour with staffers present. Finally the ? from unqualified Franken had to do with the Trump campaign not senate responsibility. McCaskill, Schumer, Pelosi etc et al had mtgs that they failed to remember actually they lied I guess.

The many meetings with Russian officials and surrogates don't bother me as much as the lying about it. If everything is on the up-and-up, as I'm sure some contacts were as routine parts of a political campaign, why not just "fess up" and admit the number and scope of the meetings? Embarrassment at potentially being used or "played" by a foreign power or something more sinister? There does appear to be something to hide in that the confessions come only after discovery, and everyone's minds (those people now in charge of our government) are "fuzzy" as to the details. THAT is the suspicious part, especially after the Flynn debacle. People lie to protect themselves - we're not trying to take away Trump's presidency only to root out the truth on an issue, the manipulation of free elections, that has worldwide consequences.
I do not understand the lying about the contacts. Evidence shows that the contacts were routine contacts in which  government officials often participate.
I don't think smooching with the enemy  is routine campaigning.  Let alone have the enemy endorse you!  Nothing normal about this situation.

Hillary Clinton: "Go ahead everyone, look at Benghazi!" Nothing illegal found.

Hillary Clinton: "Go ahead everyone, look at my emails!" Nothing illegal found.

Nixon and Trump, deny, deny, deny, avoid, avoid, avoid. If you work hard to keep the FBI away, you are SO guilty. Go see the great conversation the New Yorker had with John Dean comparing Nixon and Trump.

Putin knew a man and his team busy inventing and manufacturing conspiracies at every turn would not be able to see a real one right before their eyes--with themselves at the center--played against each other.

HIGH SIERRA seems to get around more than one might think (according to the same source you cited, pete mac):

High Sierra
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
High Sierra may refer to:
High Sierra (biome), a region of California
Sierra Nevada (U.S.), a mountain range in California also called the High Sierra or High Sierras
High Sierra Trail, a hiking trail which crosses the Sierra Nevada
High Sierra (film), a 1941 film starring Humphrey Bogart and Ida Lupino
High Sierra Format, an early CD-ROM filesystem, developed in 1986
High Sierra Music Festival, an annual music festival held in Quincy, California since 1991
High Sierra Search and Rescue, a short-lived 1995 TV series

It is revealing that easily 90% of the comments here dont mention the greyball tool at all.   Which is the whole point of the article.  I dont think these folks understand how it was used or its implications and then used the comments to crit or praise Uber.

Why the denial? Why the continued emphasis on how huge the victory was? I'm getting the feeling that maybe it was a closer election than it appeared, and maybe there is something there.
Let's have open congressional hearings, Maybe 2 or 3 will do instead of continual Republican style Bengazzi's.

Scott Walker neglects to mention that since his "reforms" were instituted we have undergone a teacher shortage in Wisconsin. The number of college students interested in pursuing a career in education has dropped like a rock, leading Walker and his allies to propose lowering standards for teachers.

Walker also likes to portray himself as "unintimidated", yet he, unlike previous governors, comes to his office in the capitol through a tunnel rather than through the capitol's hallways. To this day he is "unintimidated," in that he holds town hall meetings throughout the state, for invited participants only.

Scott Walker has only one purpose in mind . . . pose for right-wing holy pictures so he can position himself to run for President in 2020 or 2024.

This is Walker's advertisement for a job at the Heritage Foundation.
He eviscerated public and state unions.
He gave a science based DNR that protected WI's wildlife and environment into the hands of a developer.
He defunded one of America's best publc university, undergraduate and grade school systems.
He passed some of the most restrictive laws on women's reproductive freedom and health. Most were struck down.
He refused expansion of Medicaid depriving the uninsured health insurance.
He passed a gerrymandering bill so unfair Federal Courts struck it down.
He passed multiple bills to suppress the votes of minorities and students.
He turned the agency responsible for supporting businesses into a slush fund for his donors.
Our roads and bridges are crumbling but fear of losing a sinecure in a reactionary foundation causes him to refuse to raise the gasoline tax.
The NY Times made a previous error in giving this person who diminished our state to further his ambitions precious space on the Opinion Pages.

Ami,

I lived in North Carolina for 6 years and I can tell you I encountered these two kinds of people there. Similarly were those who held the prevailing opinion that there are two kinds of people from the North who are in the South - Yankees and Damn Yankees.

The difference? Damn Yankees stay.

So I left.

I did not like the feeling that behind the southern gentility lay a hatred that extends back to the 18th century, when sectionalism reared its ugly head and set our nation on a course it has yet to steer fully away from. Even Southerners I became friendly with would make no bones about the fact that they harbored that hatred for us Yankees and desperately wished for the South to return to its "days of glory."

Jeff Sessions appears to me to be a Southerner who thinks that way and has committed the error of making his feelings known at times. He, like many Southerners, will deny it but in the end the truth will out.

Is not the case that Putin has seized and annexed Crimera, is supporting a seperatist war in part of Ukraine, is conducting a cyber attack and propaganda war in the Baltic States, France, Germany, Italy, Holland and America while the Trump campaign and adminstration waters down the Republican platform, lies about contact with Russians and debates an appeasement agreement?

It's pretty obvious that Putin's goal is to divide the West, discredit democracy and the free press, extend his influence and even seize territory. Trump is in a bromance while Putin exploits the chaos. Frightening.

So Trump would have us believe that all these meetings were innocent. Well then, tell us exactly what they were about.  And why lie about them?  Sorry, but it's a bit hard to believe that the same group of people who gave us the last six weeks of amateur hour chaos were, before the election, carefully laying the groundwork for their foreign policy by meeting with Russian officials. Laughable!  And Jeff Sessions, going into a hearing knowing that the Russia question was going to be asked, still "forgot" they he had met with the Russian ambassador. Twice. Trump must think we are all as gullible as the people who voted for him.

So many questions...
If it's so common for campaigns to meet with foreign ambassadors, how many other ambassadors were brought to Trump Tower to meet with Flynn, Kushner, et al?
If Flynn and Kushner met with the Russian ambassador at Trump tower, was Pence really in the dark and misled or is that also a lie?
If Trump knew all along that Sessions, Flynn, Kushner, and who knows who else, was meeting with Kislyak, why would he repeatedly lie that no one associated with him has spoken with Russians?
Why would so many people from one campaign need to meet with so many people who are politically connected in Russia?
So many lies...
Gotta be a serious motive.
In 2005 the Trump boys noted that a lot of Russian money was pouring into Trump Inc.
This might not be so "front and center" if Trump hadn't asked Russians to hack Clinton's emails.   The trail leads to him and I hope it's exposed.

When I think of the republican's reaction after the video showing Obama saying to the Russian leader that with a change in congress, the United States and Russia would be able to work better and how they now try to pretend that nothing happened, it's quite pathetic
The Obama Administration delivered over $1 Billion in Cash to Iran which sponsors terrorism and I don't remember any Media outcry.
Um, perhaps that's because you didn't bother to learn the facts about this event?
If only the press investigated more aggressively after President Obama's statements in July and October before the election about Russian meddling...sigh.

I must say that the drip, drip, drip of this metastasizing scandal is karmically delicious.  I envision that by Summer's end I will be popping open a nice bottle of sparkling wine to celebrate the end of our national nightmare.
Entering extremely dangerous turfs - Civil War
Entering extremely dangerous turfs - Civil War (not cultural but otherwise)
This whole Russian infatuation is sad and comical.  The Democrats are sounding very McCarthy-ite in their witch hunting.
